Description

180g Vinyl LP Pressed at QRP!

KISS celebrates the 40th Anniversary of the release of their 1974 albums, KISS (debut album) & Hotter Than Hell, with re-mastered reissues on 180g Vinyl!

The 1979 album "Dynasty", and its following tour, was billed as the "Return of Kiss" since they had not released a studio album since 1977's "Love Gun".

Due to an unfortunate car accident in 1978, Peter Criss' drumming became hindered leading to the hiring of Anton Fig to perform drums on all tracks except "Dirty Livin'".

Dynasty is the first album that the original four members did not all appear together for the entire album.

Features:

 Heavyweight 180 Gram Vinyl

 Pressed at QRP

Musicians:

Paul Stanley

Gene Simmons

Ace Frehley

Peter Criss

Anton Fig - drums on all except "Dirty Livin'"

Vini Poncia - backing vocals, keyboards

Selections:

1. Charisma

2. Dirty Livin'

3. Hard Times

4. I Was Made For Lovin' You

5. Magic Touch

6. Save Your Love

7. Sure Know Something

8. X-Ray Eyes

9. 2,000 Years
